gw.api.util

Class RetryableException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • gw.pl.exception.GWWrapperException
            • gw.api.util.WrapperException
              • gw.api.util.RetryableException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SuspendableException

    public class RetryableException
extends WrapperException
    This class is a wrapper that suggests a behavior of the catcher. I.e., this error is an error in processing not an error in the object being processed. If this same process is attempted later it may succeeed. There are constructors that take a displaykey or string. There are also constructors that take a suggested retry time, if the creator can determine that. (i.e., if the service does not want to perform between 800 and 1600 this could be set to 1600) This is a wraper exception since there is a cause with the error information.
    Author:
    dandrews
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getSuggestedRetryTime

        public java.util.Date getSuggestedRetryTime()
        This is the time that the creator of the exception thinks its okay to retry the operation. This concept applies to an individual object operation for this exception class or all operations on the suspendable class. This typically will be null, indicating that the creator has no clue as to when it would be okay to retry.
        Returns:
        a datetime to retry, it maybe null.
